tool.name: Statistical analysis of functional profiles

param.name: ids
param.label: Enter your ID list (only Entrez Gene ID or UniProt accession number allowed
param.help: Copy/paste or ID list from a file (e.g. table)

param.name: text
param.label: Copy/paste your identifiers
param.help: IDs must be separated by spaces into the form field, for example: P31946 P62258

param.name: id_type
param.label: Please select the type of your IDs list

param.name: file
param.label: Choose a file that contains your list of IDs

param.name: ncol
param.label: The column number of IDs to use
param.help: For example, fill in "c1" if it is the first column, "c2" if it is the second column and so on

param.name: header
param.label: Does your input file contain header?

param.name: id_type
param.label: Please select the type of your IDs list

param.name: level
param.label: Level of the ontology at which the profile has to be built (the higher this number, the deeper the GO level)

param.name: per
param.label: Plot absolute or relative frequencies (not summing to 100)

tool.help:
**Description** This tool, based on the goProfiles R package, performs statistical analysis of functional profiles. It is based on GO ontology, functional profile at a given GO level is obtained by counting the number of identifiers having a hit in each category of this level.
-----
**Input** A list of IDs either a gene set ('Entrez' ID) or a protein set (Uniprot accession number) as input. List of IDs can be entered in a copy/paste manner or by selecting a file with IDs. If you have other type of ID, please use the ID_Converter tool of ProteoRE
-----
**Parameters** "Select species": two species are currently supported: Homo sapiens and Mus musculus (Rattus norvegicus coming soon) "Select GO terms category": you can choose one or more GO categories: Biological Process (BP), Cellular Component (CC) and Molecular Function (MF) "Level of GO ontology": level of GO ontology are from 1 to 3 (set to 2 by default). In general the higher the level, the more semantically specific the GO term is.
-----
**Output** Graphical output are in the form of bar-plot or dot-plot (png, jpeg or pdf format) Textual output: for each GO category (BP, CC, MF) the following information are returned: GO term description (e.g. CC.Description), GO term identifier (e.g CC.GOID) and its (reltive or absolute) frequency (e.g. CC.Frequency)
-----
